snippet: On Saturday, Floyd Mayweather Jr. remained unbeaten by holding off Miguel Cotto in a unanimous decision victory at the MGM’s Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas.
abstract: Floyd Mayweather Jr defeats Miguel Cotto by unanimous decision to claim WBA super welterweight title; Mayweather remains undefeated. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS -- Late Saturday, Miguel Cotto did to Floyd Mayweather what opponents rarely, if ever, do to Floyd Mayweather. Cotto made him bleed. It started when Cotto landed a quick, direct left hand square on Mayweather's nose in the fifth round. Blood trickled down his chin and dripped off his face, an announcement to the packed Grand Garden Arena that Mayweather, the self-proclaimed best boxer in the sport's history, had himself a fight.

headline.main: Mayweather's Win Is Unanimous but Not Easy
